snippet: A federal judge in Manhattan found a “substantial likelihood” that the city and state violated federal law in cutting back Medicaid-financed care for hundreds of New Yorkers.
abstract: Federal Judge Shira A Scheindlin in Manhattan issues a preliminary injunction ordering New York City to stop reducing or terminating so-called split shift home care for disabled Medicaid patients; says that there is strong evidence that such care had been reduced or terminated because of confusing and contradictory interpretations of New York State rules for Medicaid, likely influenced by pressure to cut the program's costs.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Manhattan found a “substantial likelihood” that the city and state violated federal law in cutting back Medicaid-financed care for hundreds of New Yorkers.

headline.seo: Some Medicaid Home Care Cuts in New York Are Stopped by Court
headline.main: U.S. Court Halts Some Cuts for Medicaid Home Care
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court Halts Some Cuts For Medicaid Home Care
